location: Alexandria. A room in CLEOPATRA's palace.

lines.text: Enter DEMETRIUS and PHILO

lines.speaker: philo
lines.text: Nay, but this dotage of our general's O'erflows the measure: those his goodly eyes, That o'er the files and musters of the war Have glow'd like plated Mars, now bend, now turn, The office and devotion of their view Upon a tawny front: his captain's heart, Which in the scuffles of great fights hath burst The buckles on his breast, reneges all temper, And is become the bellows and the fan To cool a gipsy's lust. Look, where they come: Take but good note, and you shall see in him. The triple pillar of the world transform'd Into a strumpet's fool: behold and see.
Flourish. Enter ANTONY, CLEOPATRA, her Ladies, the Train, with Eunuchs fanning her

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: If it be love indeed, tell me how much.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: There's beggary in the love that can be reckon'd.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: I'll set a bourn how far to be beloved.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Then must thou needs find out new heaven, new earth.
Enter an Attendant

lines.speaker: attendant
lines.text: News, my good lord, from Rome.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Grates me: the sum.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Nay, hear them, Antony: Fulvia perchance is angry; or, who knows If the scarce-bearded Caesar have not sent His powerful mandate to you, 'Do this, or this; Take in that kingdom, and enfranchise that; Perform 't, or else we damn thee.'

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: How, my love!

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Perchance! nay, and most like: You must not stay here longer, your dismission Is come from Caesar; therefore hear it, Antony. Where's Fulvia's process? Caesar's I would say? both? Call in the messengers. As I am Egypt's queen, Thou blushest, Antony; and that blood of thine Is Caesar's homager: else so thy cheek pays shame When shrill-tongued Fulvia scolds. The messengers!

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Let Rome in Tiber melt, and the wide arch Of the ranged empire fall! Here is my space. Kingdoms are clay: our dungy earth alike Feeds beast as man: the nobleness of life Is to do thus; when such a mutual pair And such a twain can do't, in which I bind, On pain of punishment, the world to weet We stand up peerless.
Embracing

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Excellent falsehood! Why did he marry Fulvia, and not love her? I'll seem the fool I am not; Antony Will be himself.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: But stirr'd by Cleopatra. Now, for the love of Love and her soft hours, Let's not confound the time with conference harsh: There's not a minute of our lives should stretch Without some pleasure now. What sport tonight?

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Hear the ambassadors.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Fie, wrangling queen! Whom every thing becomes, to chide, to laugh, To weep; whose every passion fully strives To make itself, in thee, fair and admired! No messenger, but thine; and all alone To-night we'll wander through the streets and note The qualities of people. Come, my queen; Last night you did desire it: speak not to us.
Exeunt MARK ANTONY and CLEOPATRA with their train

lines.speaker: demetrius
lines.text: Is Caesar with Antonius prized so slight?

lines.speaker: philo
lines.text: Sir, sometimes, when he is not Antony, He comes too short of that great property Which still should go with Antony.

lines.speaker: demetrius
lines.text: I am full sorry That he approves the common liar, who Thus speaks of him at Rome: but I will hope Of better deeds to-morrow. Rest you happy!
Exeunt
